comments.body: So the user-facing nomenclature does not change?

TBH initially I wanted to distinguish b/w backend (_upstream/downstream_) and everything else (_parent/child_)... but now I increasingly see that this distinction is more and more artificial/useless. WDYT guys about just having _parent/child_ on every level of abstraction? CC @micpiotrowski

I fully agree with your second thoughts. I (probably only?) see neither specific difference nor advantage b/w these names within the backend module. In general project scope, it is more intuitive (to me) to use _parent/child_ naming.
Ok! renamed everywhere to parent/child then, case closed (hopefully)
